title: Romantic Valentine one-page interaction with evasive No button and Yes reveal meme

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic Valentine prompt screen that asks: "Will you be my Valentine?" and shows exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".

quotes:
Create an interactive web page... have only one purpose: to ask her to be my Valentine.
There should be two options: Yes or No.

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the page shows the question text "Will you be my Valentine?" and two clearly visible buttons labeled "Yes" and "No".
There are no additional flows, menus, or unrelated content on the initial screen.

requirements.text: Implement an evasive "No" option that moves away when the user attempts to interact with it, preventing it from being clicked (support both mouse/trackpad and iPad touch interactions).

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: When the pointer hovers over (or approaches) the "No" button, the button repositions to a different spot on the screen.
On touch devices (e.g., iPad), attempting to tap the "No" button causes it to move before the tap can activate a click action.
The "No" button cannot be successfully clicked/activated through normal interaction.

requirements.text: When the user clicks "Yes", replace the prompt UI with a result view that displays a meme image containing the text: "Good Choice Doctor Zara Ji" (exact casing and spacing preserved as provided), and hide/disable the Yes/No options.

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her "Good Choice Doctor Zara Ji  ".

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Yes" shows a meme image and no longer shows the two-option prompt.
The displayed meme image includes the text "Good Choice Doctor Zara Ji".
The "No" evasive behavior is no longer relevant/visible after "Yes" is clicked.

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive romantic theme using a pink-and-white color scheme across the layout, typography, buttons, and background, optimized for iPad Chrome (responsive, centered content, comfortable touch targets).

quotes: The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme and be fully interactive ... run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: Primary UI uses pink and white as dominant colors (background, accents, buttons).
Buttons are large enough for touch (no tiny tap targets) and layout adapts to tablet viewport sizes without overflow or clipped content.
Overall styling remains simple and romantic (consistent fonts, spacing, and visual hierarchy).

requirements.text: Add the generated meme image to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and load it directly from the frontend (do not fetch the image via the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: A generated image file exists at frontend/public/assets/generated and is referenced by the UI after clicking "Yes".
The app does not require backend endpoints to display the meme image.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or the immutable hook/entry paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend changes are not required for this feature set.
nonGoals: Internet Identity authentication or any login flow
Persisting user interaction state in the backend
Additional pages beyond the single Valentine prompt and the post-Yes result view

required: Square meme-style image with the overlaid text "Good Choice Doctor Zara Ji" in bold, high-contrast lettering on a humorous romantic backdrop (meme-good-choice.dim_800x800.png)
